1.description: Leads the defense of Minas Tirith as the city faces the greatest siege in its history. His power and authority as the White Wizard are fully displayed as he coordinates the battle against Sauron's vast host.

relationships.Denethor: At odds with the mad Steward

1.description: Serves as a Guard of the Citadel in Minas Tirith, sworn to the service of Denethor. Though still young and inexperienced, he shows growing courage and loyalty in the face of the city's greatest peril.
The Ruling Steward of Gondor, driven to despair by grief for Boromir and the hopelessness he sees in his palantír. Once noble and wise, he has become bitter and paranoid, refusing aid and counsel.

8.description: Arrives at the Battle of Pelennor Fields with the reinforcements from southern Gondor, turning the tide of battle. Reveals himself as the rightful king returned, fulfilling ancient prophecies.

10.description: Continues toward Mount Doom carrying the Ring, which becomes an ever-greater burden. Gollum's treachery leads them into Shelob's tunnel, where Frodo is stung and appears dead to Sam.
Believes Frodo is dead after Shelob's attack and takes the Ring to continue the mission. Shows incredible courage by facing the giant spider alone and driving her off to protect his master.
Reveals his treachery by leading Frodo and Sam into Shelob's tunnel, hoping the spider will kill them so he can reclaim the Ring from their remains. His long-laid plan finally comes to fruition.

An ancient giant spider, last child of Ungoliant, who lairs in the tunnels near Mordor. Huge and terrible, she has fed on orcs and unwary travelers for ages. Gollum has made a pact to bring her fresh meat.

5.description: Becomes a Knight of Rohan in service to King Théoden. Despite being small among the horse-lords, his courage and loyalty earn him great respect. Rides to war despite being told to stay behind.
Leads the Rohirrim to the aid of Gondor in their darkest hour. Shows the full nobility of his character as he rides to battle knowing it may mean his death, but doing his duty as an ally.

2.description: Niece of King Théoden and a shieldmaiden of Rohan. Beautiful and strong-willed, she despairs at being left behind while the men ride to war. Shows interest in Aragorn but is not returned.

6.description: Disguises herself as the warrior Dernhelm and rides to battle despite being commanded to stay behind. Shows the fierce courage of her people by defying orders to fight for those she loves.

4.description: Returns to Minas Tirith wounded from his mission and faces his father's wrath and despair. Unlike his brother Boromir, he was not tempted by the Ring and aided Frodo's mission.
Chief of the Nine Nazgûl and Sauron's most terrible servant. Leads the siege of Minas Tirith and breaks the gates of the city. Ancient prophecy says no living man can kill him.

6.description: Noble Prince of Dol Amroth who leads reinforcements from southern Gondor. Tall and dark-haired with keen grey eyes, he shows the bearing of ancient Númenórean nobility.

1.description: A Guard of the Citadel who becomes Pippin's friend and guide in Minas Tirith. Shows the hobbit the customs and defenses of the great city.
Young son of Beregond, about ten years old. Eager and proud of his father's service, he shows Pippin around the lower levels of Minas Tirith.

8.description: Eldest of the women who serve in the Houses of Healing. Known for her herb-lore and her saying that 'the hands of the king are the hands of a healer.'

relationships.Aragorn: Recognizes as true king by his healing power

5.description: Marshal of Rohan and nephew of King Théoden. Leads the Rohirrim cavalry in the great charge at Pelennor Fields. Brother to Éowyn.

2.description: Leader of the Dead Men of Dunharrow, cursed for breaking their oath to Isildur. Appears as a pale king crowned with a circlet, leading the host of oath-breakers.

relationships.Aragorn: Heir who can release from curse
relationships.Dunharrow: Bound to the Stone of Erech

9.description: The Black Númenórean who serves as Sauron's herald and lieutenant. Tall and menacing, he mocks the Army of the West at the Black Gate with tokens from Frodo and Sam.

17.description: The fallen wizard who has taken control of the Shire under the name 'Sharkey.' His ruffians have industrialized and polluted the hobbits' homeland.
Former counselor of Théoden who accompanied Saruman in his exile. Appears wretched and cowering, completely under the fallen wizard's dominance.
The miller of Hobbiton who collaborated with the ruffians. Always quick to cause trouble and gossip, he sided with Saruman's men against his fellow hobbits.

19.description: Ancient elf-lord and keeper of the Grey Havens. Has long grey hair and beard, showing his great age even among the Eldar. Keeper of Narya, one of the Three Rings.

relationships.Narya: Bearer of the Ring of Fire

12.description: Lord of the Great Eagles who leads his people in the final battle at the Black Gate. Swift and mighty, with keen eyes that see far across Middle-earth.
Brother of Gwaihir and mighty among the Great Eagles. Fights in the final battle and helps rescue Frodo and Sam from Mount Doom.
Youngest of the Great Eagles who participates in the final battle. Swift and keen-sighted like all his kindred.

5.description: Marshal of Rohan who leads one of the éoreds in the great cavalry charge at Pelennor Fields. Steadfast and brave in the face of overwhelming odds.
Théoden's banner-bearer who carries the king's standard into battle at Pelennor Fields. Shows great courage in the cavalry charge.
Marshal of Rohan who leads part of the cavalry in the charge at Pelennor Fields. Known for his fierce courage and loyalty to Théoden.

1.description: Lord of Lossarnach who brings two hundred men to the defense of Minas Tirith. Despite his nickname 'the Fat,' he is a valiant fighter and loyal vassal.
Lord of the Green Hills who brings three hundred gallant green-clad men to aid Minas Tirith. Known for his fair appearance and brave heart.
Lord of Morthond who brings five hundred bowmen to defend Minas Tirith. His archers are skilled and disciplined fighters from the southern fiefs.
Elder son of Lord Duinhir who leads his father's archers. Tall and keen-eyed like all the men of Morthond.
Younger son of Lord Duinhir who serves alongside his brother leading the archers of Morthond in defense of Minas Tirith.
Lord of Anfalas who brings few men but much needed supplies to Minas Tirith. Shows that even distant fiefs answer Gondor's call in the hour of need.

3.description: Théoden's beloved white horse, swift and proud like all the mearas. Carries the king faithfully into battle at Pelennor Fields.

16.description: Sam's sweetheart from Hobbiton, daughter of Farmer Cotton. Waited faithfully for Sam's return from the great adventure.
Sturdy farmer and father of Rose Cotton. One of the hobbits who organized resistance against the ruffians during their occupation of the Shire.
The Mayor of Michel Delving who was imprisoned by the ruffians for opposing their rule. Represents the legitimate government of the Shire.
Frodo's friend who helped organize resistance in the Shire during the ruffians' occupation. Stayed behind when Frodo left on the quest but proved his courage defending his homeland.

17.description: A hobbit who was forced to serve as a 'Shirriff' under the ruffians' rule but remained loyal to his fellow hobbits at heart.

relationships.Hobbits: Loyal to his people despite coercion

17.description: Leader of the ruffians who occupied the Shire under Saruman's orders. A rough, cruel man who shows contempt for the hobbits and their peaceful ways.

19.description: Noble elf who helped Frodo at the beginning of his journey and now comes to bid farewell as the elves depart Middle-earth forever.
Lord of Rivendell and keeper of Vilya, mightiest of the Three Rings. With Sauron's defeat, the power of the Rings fades and he must depart Middle-earth.

relationships.Vilya: Bearer of the Ring of Air

19.description: Lady of Lothlórien and keeper of Nenya, one of the Three Rings. With the One Ring's destruction, her power wanes and she must sail into the West.

relationships.Nenya: Bearer of the Ring of Water

2.description: Elf of the Woodland Realm who accompanies Aragorn on the Paths of the Dead. His keen sight and woodland skills prove invaluable on the dangerous path.
Dwarf of Erebor who follows Aragorn into the Paths of the Dead despite his people's fear of such places. His courage overcomes his natural dread of the undead.

recaps.1: Gandalf brings Pippin to Minas Tirith, where they meet Denethor, the despairing Ruling Steward. The city prepares for siege as Sauron's vast army approaches.
recaps.2: Aragorn, revealed as Isildur's heir, takes the Paths of the Dead with Legolas and Gimli. Éowyn despairs at being left behind while the men ride to war.
recaps.3: The beacons of Gondor are lit, calling Rohan to aid. Théoden musters the Rohirrim for the ride to Minas Tirith, taking Merry as his knight.
recaps.4: The siege of Minas Tirith begins as Sauron's army surrounds the city. Faramir returns wounded, and Denethor's madness grows as he despairs of victory.
recaps.5: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields begins as the Rohirrim arrive at dawn. The Witch-king mortally wounds Théoden, but Éowyn (disguised as Dernhelm) destroys him.
recaps.6: Aragorn arrives with reinforcements from southern Gondor, turning the tide of battle. Prince Imrahil leads the final charge that breaks Sauron's army.
recaps.7: Denethor's madness reaches its peak as he attempts to burn himself and Faramir alive. Pippin and Beregond save Faramir, but Denethor immolates himself.
recaps.8: The leaders of the West hold a final council and decide to march on the Black Gate to draw Sauron's attention from Frodo's mission.
recaps.9: The Army of the West marches to the Morannon, Sauron's Black Gate. They challenge the Dark Lord to battle, hoping to give Frodo time to reach Mount Doom.
recaps.10: Sam discovers Frodo is alive after Shelob's attack and rescues him from the orc tower. They disguise themselves as orcs to cross Mordor toward Mount Doom.
recaps.11: Frodo and Sam struggle across the desolate plains of Mordor. The Ring's weight becomes almost unbearable as they approach Mount Doom, and Frodo begins to fail.
recaps.12: At the Battle of the Morannon, the Army of the West faces Sauron's overwhelming host. All seems lost as they are vastly outnumbered by orcs and evil men.
recaps.13: At the Cracks of Doom, Frodo finally succumbs to the Ring's power and claims it for himself. Gollum attacks him, bites off his finger, and falls into the lava with the Ring.
recaps.14: The Ring is destroyed and Sauron is defeated. Mount Doom erupts as his power fails, and Eagles rescue Frodo and Sam from the destruction.
recaps.15: Aragorn is crowned King Elessar of Gondor and Arnor. The Age of Men begins as he restores the kingdoms and ushers in a time of peace and prosperity.
recaps.16: The hobbits are honored above all others for their deeds. They prepare to return to the Shire, but learn that their homeland has also suffered under Saruman's rule.
recaps.17: The hobbits return to find the Shire under the control of ruffians led by 'Sharkey.' They rally the hobbits and fight the Battle of Bywater to free their homeland.
recaps.18: Sharkey is revealed to be Saruman, who is killed by Wormtongue in the aftermath of his defeat. The Shire is restored to its former beauty under the hobbits' care.
recaps.19: Two years later, Frodo joins Gandalf, Elrond, and Galadriel at the Grey Havens. Still bearing spiritual wounds from the Morgul-blade and Ring, he sails into the West.
recaps.20: Sam returns home to his wife Rose and their children. The other hobbits live long, honored lives. The Fourth Age begins as the time of the Elves ends and Men inherit Middle-earth.
